#Text=Peter
#Text=Hogan
#Text=For the Australian footballer , see Peter Hogan ( footballer ) .
#Text=Recorded with Peter Hogan at Stoke Newington Literary Festival 2013 .
#Text=Peter Kenneth Hogan

#Text=( born 5 May 1954 ) is an English writer and comics creator who started out as editor of cult political British comic Revolver in 1990 – 1991 , before working for 2000 AD and American comic book publishers Vertigo and America 's Best Comics .
#Text=Biography
#Text=Hogan first worked as commissioning editor for Eel Pie Publishing from the late 1970s to the early 1980s .
#Text=He managed the Magic Bus Bookstore in Richmond until its closure in 1982 .
#Text=His known associates at that time were Dave Marsh and Patrick Humphries , Rock Music journalists .
#Text=He also was a contributing writer to a biography about The Monkees pop group and a movie/DVD correspondent for Uncut magazine .
#Text=Hogan is the brother-in-law of noted UK comic artist/typographer/design guru Rian Hughes .

#Text=After Revolver folded , Hogan became a scriptwriter for the 2000 AD comic , working on short story series Vector 13 and Tharg ' s Dragon Tales , as well as reinventing the long-running Strontium Dog series as Strontium Dogs and supervising the Durham Red spin-off series .
#Text=Hogan also had a short stint working on Sam Slade , Robo-Hunter .
#Text=He also created the gentle fantasy Timehouse .
#Text=Hogan 's writing is noted for a whimsical , fantastic quality that stood out from the more usual hard-edged sci-fi to appear under the 2000 AD banner .

#Text=However , when David Bishop took on the editorship of 2000 AD , he informed Hogan that he would commission no more of Hogan 's scripts because he " did n't believe his writing fitted the comic [ he ] wanted 2000

#Text=Known , with great affection , by many of  The Ealing Lot " as The Count – for his legendary nocturnal working habits .
